attributes.title: World Cup ticket sales
attributes.description:
Created on April 14, 2010 by dnklatt on Sourcemap.org:

More than two million tickets have been sold for the 2010 World Cup, but organizers are worried they could end up with empty seats when the matches get underway. Here is a map of who is buying those tickets around the globe.

attributes.name: World Cup ticket sales
attributes.title: World Cup ticket sales
attributes.description: More than two million tickets have been sold for the 2010 World Cup, but organizers are worried they could end up with empty seats when the matches get underway. Here is a map of who is buying those tickets around the globe.

attributes.name: Soccer fans
attributes.title: Soccer fans
attributes.description: Host fans have purchased 925,437 World Cup tickets, which are available at a reduced rate.

attributes.name: Soccer fans
attributes.title: Soccer fans
attributes.description: World Cup fans living in America have purchased 118,945 tickets -- the most of any visiting country.

attributes.name: Soccer fans
attributes.title: Soccer fans
attributes.description: Only 67,654 tickets have been sold to fans living in the UK. Organizers are worried that concerns over public safety and recent terroristic threats may leave seats empty.

attributes.name: Soccer fans
attributes.title: Soccer fans
attributes.description: Fans in Germany have picked up 32,269 tickets so far. Its a surprisingly low number from a European soccer power.
